thread.title: Mixed emotions: Zion-Benton prevails late as Waukegan honors Malik Brown
thread.title_full: Mixed emotions: Zion-Benton prevails late as Waukegan honors Malik Brown

author: LaMond Pope
title: Mixed emotions: Zion-Benton prevails late as Waukegan honors Malik Brown
text:
Mixed emotions: Zion-Benton prevails late as Waukegan honors Malik Brown Mixed emotions: Zion-Benton prevails late as Waukegan honors Malik Brown Mark Kodiak Ukena / Lake County News-Sun Zion-Benton's Rod Henry-Hayes prepares to slam a dunk during Friday's game with Waukegan. Zion-Benton's Rod Henry-Hayes prepares to slam a dunk during Friday's game with Waukegan. (Mark Kodiak Ukena / Lake County News-Sun) Privacy Policy 
Players and coaches from the Waukegan boys basketball team came over and hugged members of Malik Brown's family at half court. 
The school had just completed a ceremony in honor of Brown, who died in a car crash last weekend. 
There were songs and then a moment of silence for Brown, 17, who was a member of the Bulldogs' sophomore team. 
And there also was the game against Zion-Benton. And what a game it was. 
Damarquis Henry made a go-ahead 3-pointer with 51.8 seconds remaining Friday and the Zee-Bees held on for a 73-70 North Suburban victory at Waukegan. 
Henry's 3-pointer gave the Zee-Bees (18-8, 8-3) a 71-70 lead. Jaalen Ray made two free throws with 6.5 seconds left to wrap up the win. 
Henry scored 21 points and Ray had 16. Rod Henry-Hayes led the Zee-Bees with 23 points before fouling out. 
DeShawn Davidson and Bryant Brown both scored 22 points for Waukegan (14-8, 6-4). 
Davidson helped Waukegan to a fast start. He scored seven of the Bulldogs' first 11 points. He stole the ball and then scored a layup to give Waukegan an 11-4 lead with 4:53 remaining in the first quarter. 
Davidson made a jumper with 21 seconds left in the first quarter to extend Waukegan's lead to 22-9. 
It looked like a blowout was in the works. But then the Zee-Bees started to rally. Zion-Benton used a 13-2 spurt to get within 24-22 in the second quarter. 
Henry-Hayes led the way during the comeback, scoring nine of the Zee-Bees' 13 points in the stretch. 
Davison made a jumper for Waukegan, but Henry answered with a banked 3-pointer to make it 26-25 with 5:21 left in the first half. That's as close as Zion-Benton would get for the rest of the half. 
Davidson scored seven points during an 8-2 streak as Waukegan stretched its lead to 34-27. 
The Bulldogs closed the half with another 8-2 streak and led 42-33 at halftime. 
Carson Newsome made a 3-pointer to give Waukegan a 49-39 lead in the third quarter. Zion-Benton got within six, but baskets by Bryant Brown and Ja'Dyn Brown extended Waukegan's lead to 55-45 with 2:20 remaining in the third quarter. 
Zion-Benton cut its deficit to 55-50 with two free throws by Henry-Hayes with 55.1 seconds left in the quarter. Waukegan led 57-50 heading into the fourth. 
Zion-Benton fought all the way back to tie the game at 60. Ray scored while getting fouled and then made the free throw to tie the game with 6:36 remaining. 
It remained tight to the end, with Henry coming through late to lead the Zee-Bees to the win. 
Twitter @lamondpope
